name: The Mother: The BRAND NEW addictive, pulse-pounding thriller from Valerie Keogh, author of NUMBER ONE BESTSELLER The Nurse for 2024

title: WOW
content: Literally had my heart on edge the whole time! A MUST READ! Will not want to put the book down
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024

title: Mother May I.
content: Omg very dark and twisted tale of love and the g things twisted lovfe does to people and makes some do to those they love
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024

title: another not what you expected as the story twists and turns as much as a pinwheel in a hurricane …..
content: No spoilers because you just have to read it to believe —— the ending coming at you like a rogue hit an run leaving you speechless as you pick up the pieces  Found this one after another one of Valerie Keogh’s books ….. it all started with The  Nurse which was available on Amazon. I think I’m going to bing read everything I can get my hands on by this author. There’s never a dull moment as I stay up way past my bedtime reading late into the night. These are the kind of books that leave you wanting more of the character’s lives and relationships. It’s almost like the end of a serious crush when you have the page for ratings suddenly pop up. I nearly groaned when this one plunged into an ending.  Off to Amazon to another Keogh masterpiece. It’s gonna be a long time before it’s lights out for me ……
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024

title: twisty!
content: Great story line and very twisty! Just when u think you know who did it you get surprised! Read this in 2 nights , fast read .
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024

title: GOOD READ
content: This was a really great book full of twists and suspense.. I really enjoyed the story line and thought I had the ending figured out a couple of times.

title: You think you know who the bad guy is but you don't
content: Keeps you guessing until the very last page!  Every time I thought the storyline was wrapped up there was another twist.

title: Page Turner
content: Thoroughly enjoyed this book and if you enjoy twists and turns be sure to read The Mother. It was difficult to put this book down and couldn’t wait to get to the end.

title: The Mother - A good read
content: Good read, nice plot twists. Maybe not the most believable, but a page turner none the less. Suspenseful and intriguing storyline.

title: Don't confuse love with obsession
content: I guess my take away is that we are faulty. We really aren't sure of What We want and all too often when we get exactly what we thought would be our dream come true,  well, it just isn't.  Not everyone loves. Some think possessiveness is love. For some love becomes obsession. Be careful with love. Good reading.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024

title: Secrets, lies and deceit
content: A great thriller filled with secrets, lies and deceit. Though Valerie Keogh really cannot disappoint her readers, this one was exceptionally good.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2024

title: Absolutely sucks you in!
content: When baby Kaya is abducted, the police suspect the mother, the mother suspects her best friend, the best friend suspects the mother, and Kaya’s father is completely shattered after the abduction. The bombshells just keep coming in this one.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2024

title: Gobsmacked!
content: I was kept entertained for a solid day and couldn’t put it down until I was done. I can easily recommend this book to thriller readers and give it a solid 4 stars.

title: Incredible
content: Loved the twists and turns right up until the last pages. Just when you think you have the answer, your mistaken.

title: A Guessing Game
content: Oh holy cow! Valerie Keogh knocks this one totally out of the park! Fantastic characters that kept me flipping pages long past my bedtime. Crazy great plot line that left me gobsmacked. Packed with action, secrets and lies. Another perfect storm! Totally loved it.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024

title: All I can say is WOW!
content: Thank you NetGalley, Valerie Keogh and Boldwood Books for the opportunity to read and review this cracker of a book.

title: Can't put down
content: Again a great plot and so many surprises... A jaw dropping novel. Once you start reading you will continue to the end..
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024

title: Wow!
content: As this is my first book by Valerie Keogh I have to say that the author has captured the entirety of love and obsessions.  The rippling effects of how people make dangerous decisions and wade through the aftermath.  I was enraptured with the seemingly effortless way the tale unfolds drawing the reader in to the story from the first paragraph.  Off to read another.  Happy reading.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2024

title: The Mother- A Must Read!!
content: This is another fast paced thriller from Valerie Keogh. It is impossible to put down! At first I was so aggravated at some of the characters but soon realized  I had most of them pegged wrong. Plenty of twists and turns.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024

title: Holy twists!!!
content: Holy Moly!! I’m so glad I had off of work today because I was able to read this in one sitting. There was nothing, not even a bathroom break that stopped me from carrying my kindle around all day today to read this. I recently read and reviewed The Mistress and loved it so I thought I would read another by the author and this one was even twistier. I’m not going to go into the synopsis because you can read that on your own and saying anything at all will take away the pure reading pleasure of this book. My mouth is still on the floor as the twists didn’t stop until the end and then still didn’t stop. Do not miss this one. Valerie Keogh is my new favorite author. A million thank you’s to Netgalley and Boldwood Books for the advanced copy and to Valerie Keogh for giving me the biggest book hangover ever!!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2024

title: the mother
content: Was very unexpected ending.Two many twist at the end. It would have been better if I figured out things faster

title: twisted
content: The plot was hidden throughout in details of happening.  Ending was unsuspected.  Plot was twisted at every incident.  Not sure I liked it.

title: Ridiculous story
content: This book was not what I expected.  The main character is very unlikable as is every other character in the book.  The plot has many twist and turns but not in a good way.  The story started out good but got  more and more ridiculous as it went on.  Ugh, I'm very disappointed because if this book had gone in the direction that it started with in the beginning it might have been good.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024

title: terrible book
content: Disgusting characters; authors should always have something likeable in their main people; over the top premise , sorry I wasted my reading time on it,
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2024

title: I don't write a lot of book reviews because - *** Major Spoilers****
content: I don't write a lot of book reviews - and certainly not a lot of 1 star book reviews because I understand that for writers & authors, novels and books are like their babies. And just like I wouldn't criticize a baby, it feels wrong to criticize a book.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2024

title: Obviously designed with twists in mind
content: But for this novel, I'll make an exception -

title: Very Good Read
content: I love a LONG book. I'm a 'fast' reader, even when I try to slow down and savor a good story, I tend to read like I have a pending deadline. In fact, the better the story, the faster I gobble it up. So I truly adore a longer story. I was excited to see that this book was very lengthy compared to many of the prime reads I'd partaken of recently.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024

title: Fast
content: This book made me feel as though I'd either lost my mind or inadvertently skipped over major parts.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2024
